articles.headline: The Care and Feeding of Entrepreneurs
articles.snippet: An interview with Guy Kawasaki, a best-selling author of seven books on entrepreneurship and a popular public speaker and blogger.
articles.abstract: An interview with Guy Kawasaki, a best-selling author of seven books on entrepreneurship and a popular public speaker and blogger.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUY KAWASAKI is a best-selling author of seven books on entrepreneurship, a founding partner at Garage Technology Ventures, the co-founder of Alltop.com, an “online magazine rack,” and a popular public speaker and blogger.

articles.headline: Credit Rating Agency Heads Grilled by Lawmakers
articles.snippet: Members of Congress leveled sharp criticism at what they called egregious lapses at the credit-rating agencies.
articles.abstract: Members of Congress leveled sharp criticism at what they called egregious lapses at the credit-rating agencies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Conflicts of interest were largely responsible for the disastrous performance of credit rating agencies in assessing the risks of mortgage-backed securities, two former high-ranking officials at Moody’s Investors Service and Standard & Poor’s said Wednesday in Congressional testimony.

articles.headline: Rivals Split on U.S. Power, but Ideas Defy Labels
articles.snippet: Radically different experiences have shaped the candidates’ contrasting visions for U.S. power, but both men have been forced into surprising detours.
articles.abstract: Radically different experiences have shaped the candidates’ contrasting visions for U.S. power, but both men have been forced into surprising detours.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — John McCain has said his worldview was formed in the Hanoi Hilton, the jail where as a prisoner of war he learned to stand up to his country’s enemies and lost any youthful naïveté about what happens when America shows weakness.

articles.headline: Working Longer as Jobs Contract
articles.snippet: As pensions shrink and layoffs loom, older employees are caught in the middle. Many must rethink or postpone their retirement.
articles.abstract: As pensions shrink and layoffs loom, older employees are caught in the middle. Many must rethink or postpone their retirement.
articles.lead_paragraph: IN recent years, many retirement experts have been giving the same unwelcome advice: American workers who are not as rich as Warren E. Buffett should retire three or so years later than they had planned — to ensure that they have a large enough nest egg.

articles.headline: Pro Quality Without Reflex Lens
articles.snippet: Panasonic offers a camera that matches a compact body with the photographic quality of an S.L.R.
articles.abstract: Panasonic offers a camera that matches a compact body with the photographic quality of an S.L.R.
articles.lead_paragraph: O.K., O.K., we get it. There are some things we just can’t have.

articles.headline: Drought Resistance Is the Goal, but Methods Differ
articles.snippet: Scientists are trying to create varieties of corn, wheat and other crops that can thrive with little water.
articles.abstract: Scientists are trying to create varieties of corn, wheat and other crops that can thrive with little water.
articles.lead_paragraph: GRAND ISLAND, Neb.  To satisfy the world’s growing demand for food, scientists are trying to pull off a genetic trick that nature itself has had trouble accomplishing in millions of years of evolution. They want to create varieties of corn, wheat and other crops that can thrive with little water.

articles.headline: Struggling to Keep Up as the Crisis Raced On
articles.snippet: In an interview, Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson Jr. said Lehman Brothers could not have been rescued.
articles.abstract: In an interview, Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson Jr. said Lehman Brothers could not have been rescued.
articles.lead_paragraph: “I feel like Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid. Who are these guys that just keep coming?”  Treasury Secretary Henry Paulson Jr.
articles.byline: By Joe Nocera and Edmund L. Andrews

articles.headline: $150,000 Wardrobe for Palin May Alter Tailor-Made Image
articles.snippet: Republicans feared that Gov. Sarah Palin’s “hockey mom” image would fray amid revelations that the Republican Party outfitted her from high-end stores.
articles.abstract: Republicans feared that Gov. Sarah Palin’s “hockey mom” image would fray amid revelations that the Republican Party outfitted her from high-end stores.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sarah Palin’s wardrobe joined the ranks of symbolic political excess on Wednesday, alongside John McCain’s multiple houses and John Edwards’s $400 haircut, as Republicans expressed fear that weeks of tailoring Ms. Palin as an average “hockey mom” would fray amid revelations that the Republican Party outfitted her with expensive clothing from high-end stores.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Michael Luo

articles.headline: Investors Flee as Hedge Fund Woes Deepen
articles.snippet: Hedge funds, the fast money that defined an era on Wall Street, are in the throes of an unprecedented shakeout.
articles.abstract: Hedge funds, the fast money that defined an era on Wall Street, are in the throes of an unprecedented shakeout.
articles.lead_paragraph: The gilded age of hedge funds is losing its luster. The funds, pools of fast money that defined the era of Wall Street hyper-wealth, are in the throes of an unprecedented shakeout. Even some industry stars are falling back to earth.

articles.headline: Sun Loses Co-Founder to Start-Up
articles.snippet: Andreas von Bechtolsheim is resigning as chief architect of Sun Microsystems to focus on a start-up that is challenging another industry giant, Cisco Systems.
articles.abstract: Andreas von Bechtolsheim is resigning as chief architect of Sun Microsystems to focus on a start-up that is challenging another industry giant, Cisco Systems.
articles.lead_paragraph: MENLO PARK, Calif.  Andreas von Bechtolsheim, a brilliant billionaire who has created some of the best-selling computer systems in the industry, is resigning as chief architect of Sun Microsystems to focus on a start-up that is challenging another industry giant, Cisco Systems.

articles.headline: Greenspan Concedes Error on Regulation
articles.snippet: Alan Greenspan, the former Federal Reserve chairman, said he “made a mistake” in trusting that free markets could regulate themselves.
articles.abstract: Alan Greenspan, the former Federal Reserve chairman, said he “made a mistake” in trusting that free markets could regulate themselves.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  For years, a Congressional hearing with Alan Greenspan was a marquee event. Lawmakers doted on him as an economic sage. Markets jumped up or down depending on what he said. Politicians in both parties wanted the maestro on their side.
